trans-unit.source: >>> d = dirtyjson.loads("""["foo", /* not fu*/ {bar: ['baz', null, 1.0, 2,]}] and then ignore this junk""")
trans-unit.target: >>> d = dirtyjson.loads ( "" "["foo ", / * not fu * / {bar : [ 'baz', null, 1.0, 2,]}] 그런 다음이 정크 무시" "")

trans-unit.source: >>> d == obj
>>> dirtyjson.load(io)[0] == 'streaming API'
>>> dirtyjson.loads('"\\"foo\\bar"') == u'"foo\x08ar'
>>> dirtyjson.loads('1.1', parse_float=Decimal) == Decimal('1.1')
>>> from decimal import Decimal
>>> from dirtyjson.compat import StringIO
>>> import dirtyjson
>>> io = StringIO('["streaming API"]')
>>> obj = [u'foo', {u'bar': [u'baz', None, 1.0, 2]}]
>>> pos = d.attributes(0) # line/column position of first element in array
trans-unit.target: >>> pos = d.attributes (0) # 배열에서 첫 번째 요소의 행 / 열 위치

trans-unit.source: >>> pos = d[1].attributes('bar') # line/column position of 'bar' key/value pair
trans-unit.target: >>> pos = d [1] .attributes ( 'bar') # 'bar'키 / 값 쌍의 행 / 열 위치

trans-unit.source: >>> pos.column == 2
>>> pos.key.column == 22
>>> pos.key.line == 1
>>> pos.line == 1
>>> pos.value.column == 27
>>> pos.value.line == 1

trans-unit.source: :mod:`dirtyjson` --- JSON decoder

trans-unit.source: :mod:`dirtyjson` is a JSON decoder meant for extracting JSON-type data from .js
